Package com.simpleprogrammer.infinitetcp

Class Client

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.simpleprogrammer.infinitetcp.Client
  • public class Client
extends java.lang.Object
    The class in which an connection is issued to a TCP server
    The class uses XML to serialize the data Data is sent using the @link #send(Object) method

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Client()
      Constructs a client which is bound to no IP or port
      Client​(java.lang.String ip, int port)
      Constructs a client which is bound to the specified String as an InetAddress and a int port
      Client​(java.net.InetAddress ip, int port)
      Constructs a client which is bound to the specified InetAddress and a int port

      Adds a @code Listener to the client for the receive and disconnect methods

      Binds the client to the specified InetAddress and port
      boolean isConnected()  
      boolean removeListener​(Listener listener)
      Removes the first instance of the @code Listener in the client
      void send​(java.lang.Object obj)
      Sends the specified object to the server in XML format
      void start()
      Starts the clients socket and starts receiving from it.
      void stop()
      Stops the clients socket and the input and output streams.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Client

        public Client​(java.lang.String ip,
              int port)
        Constructs a client which is bound to the specified String as an InetAddress and a int port
        Parameters:
        ip - the String from which an InetAddress is formed
        port - the port which the socket is connected to
        Both of the parameters can be changed by calling the bind(String, int) method before the client has started
        Throws:
        java.net.UnknownHostException - if the ip is not valid
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the port is out of range

      • Client

        public Client​(java.net.InetAddress ip,
              int port)
        Constructs a client which is bound to the specified InetAddress and a int port
        Parameters:
        ip - the InetAddress in which the socket is connected to
        port - the port which the socket is connected to
        Both of the parameters can be changed by calling the bind(InetAddress, int) method before the client has started
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the port is out of range

      • Client

        public Client()
        Constructs a client which is bound to no IP or port

    • Method Detail

      • bind

        public void bind​(java.lang.String ip,
                 int port)
        Binds the client to the specified InetAddress as a string and a port
        Parameters:
        ip - the InetAddress in which the Socket will be bound to
        port - thte port in which the Socket will be bound to
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the Socket is already bound
        java.net.UnknownHostException - if the String is not a valid IP
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the port is out of range

      • bind

        public void bind​(java.net.InetAddress ip,
                 int port)
        Binds the client to the specified InetAddress and port
        Parameters:
        ip - the InetAddress in which the Socket will be bound to
        port - the port in which the Socket will be bound to
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the Socket is already bound
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the port is out of range

      • start

        public void start()
           throws java.io.IOException
        Starts the clients socket and starts receiving from it.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O exception happens when starting the socket

      • stop

        public void stop()
          throws java.io.IOException
        Stops the clients socket and the input and output streams.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O exception happens when stopping the socket

      • isConnected

        public boolean isConnected()
        Returns:
        whether or not the socket is connected to a server

      • send

        public void send​(java.lang.Object obj)
        Sends the specified object to the server in XML format
        Parameters:
        obj - the Object to send
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the socket is not connected
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs when writing to the server

      • addListener

        public void addListener​(Listener listener)
        Adds a @code Listener to the client for the receive and disconnect methods
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener to be added

      • removeListener

        public boolean removeListener​(Listener listener)
        Removes the first instance of the @code Listener in the client
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener to be removed
        Returns:
        whether or not the listener was removed
